title: Judge saves the CFPB, for now
snippets: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction to prevent the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) until a final decision is made in their ongoing legal case.
summary: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction, blocking the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) until a final ruling in their legal battle.

title: Windows 11 is closing a loophole that let you skip making a Microsoft account
snippets: Microsoft has announced that in its latest Windows 11 Insider Preview, it will remove a bypass script that previously allowed users to set up Windows 11 devices without an internet connection and logging in. This change enforces the requirement for all Windows 11 devices to be connected to the internet and to use an account for setup.
summary: Microsoft will update Windows 11 Insider Preview to eliminate a script that permitted offline setup, mandating internet connection and account login for all Windows 11 device configurations.

title: The 30 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $30
snippets: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is currently underway and will run until Monday, March 31st, offering a variety of deals that are accessible without an Amazon Prime membership. The sale includes over 100 deals on popular gear, alongside a selection of low-cost alternatives.
summary: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is happening now through March 31st, featuring over 100 deals on popular items and affordable alternatives. The sale is open to all customers, not just Amazon Prime members.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI buys Elon Musk’s X for $33 billion on paper
snippets: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has purchased the social media platform X (previously Twitter) in an all-stock deal. Musk announced the acquisition, valuing xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, which includes $12 billion in debt. This move comes a few years after Musk originally bought Twitter for $44 billion.
summary: Elon Musk's AI firm, xAI, acquired the social media platform X (formerly Twitter) in an all-stock transaction. The deal values xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, incorporating $12 billion of debt. This acquisition follows Musk's initial purchase of Twitter for $44 billion a few years earlier.

title: Microsoft tests Quick Machine Recovery to restore PCs that can’t boot
snippets: Microsoft has begun testing Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653), aimed at enabling IT professionals to remotely recover Windows 11 devices that fail to boot. This feature was first announced last year, following the Crowdstrike incident, to improve device recovery processes.
summary: Microsoft is testing a new feature called Quick Machine Recovery in the latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11, designed to help IT professionals remotely recover devices that won't boot. This development follows the Crowdstrike incident last year, aiming to enhance device recovery methods.

title: The Fitbit-to-Google account migration deadline moves to 2026
snippets: Google has extended the deadline for Fitbit users to migrate their accounts to a Google account until next year. This update was communicated to users via email. The original deadline was set after Google acquired Fitbit in early 2021 and aimed to integrate Fitbit's services with its own.
summary: Google has postponed the deadline for Fitbit users to switch their accounts to Google accounts until next year, following its acquisition of Fitbit in early 2021. This extension was announced to users through an email, delaying the initial integration plan of Fitbit's services with Google's.
